Let's rewrite each value in standard form:

$\greenD{30{,}000 + 3{,}000}=\greenD{33{,}000}$

$\text{\blueD{300{,}000 + 300}}=\blueD{300{,}300}$

Now, we can use a place value chart to compare the numbers.

Hundred thousands | Ten thousands |Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$0$ | $\greenD3$| $\greenD3$ | $\greenD0$ | $\greenD0$ | $\greenD0$
$\blueD3$| $\blueD0$ | $\blueD0$ | $\blueD3$ | $\blueD0$  | $\blueD0$

options.explanation:
We start by comparing the highest place value.   

$\greenD{33{,}000}$ has fewer hundred thousands, so it is the smaller number.
